meanings.definition: Hoove (verb): to move or lift with effort or force
meanings.sent1: The heavy box was too difficult to hoove onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: She had to hoove the boulder out of the way to clear the path.
meanings.sent3: Trying to hoove the giant teddy bear up the stairs was quite a sight!
meanings.sent4: With determination, he hooved himself over the high wall.
meanings.sent5: The old car struggled to hoove up the steep hill.

meanings.definition: Hoove (noun): the hard covering on the feet of certain animals, such as horses and cows
meanings.sent1: The horse's hooves made a rhythmic sound on the dirt road.
meanings.sent2: The cow's hooves left imprints in the soft mud.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy puppy tried to chew on its own hoove!
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves were as elegant as a horse's hooves on a cobblestone street.
meanings.sent5: The hooves of the deer left delicate prints in the snow.
